cooking_method: Cook spaghetti according to package directions, fry pancetta in a pan, mix eggs, cheese, salt, and pepper in a bowl, add cooked spaghetti to the pan with pancetta and toss, then remove from heat and add egg mixture, stirring continuously until sauce thickens

Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente, reserve 1 cup of the pasta cooking water, drain the pasta, while the pasta is cooking, sauté pancetta or bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy, remove from heat, whisk egg yolks, Pecorino Romano cheese, Parmesan cheese, garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl, add 1/4 cup of the reserved pasta cooking water and whisk to combine, add the drained pasta to the skillet with the pancetta or bacon, toss to combine, pour the egg mixture over the pasta, tossing quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs, add more pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce, serve immediately

Cook pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water, drain and reserve 1 cup of pasta water, place basil, pine nuts, garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a food processor, pulse until smooth, add pasta water if necessary to thin the pesto sauce, toss pasta with pesto sauce
Alternate tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, sprinkle with basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper

Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water, drain and reserve 1 cup of pasta water, cook bacon in a skillet until crispy, remove from heat, whisk together egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, heavy cream, garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl, add hot spaghetti to the skillet with bacon, pour egg mixture over spaghetti, toss to coat the spaghetti with the sauce, add pasta water if necessary to thin the sauce

Preheat oven to 450°F, roll out pizza dough, spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle mozzarella cheese, top with fresh basil, and drizzle olive oil, bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden and cheese is melted and bubbly

Preheat oven to 400°F, season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour, dip in beaten eggs, mix bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese, coat chicken with bread crumb mixture, place chicken in a baking dish, bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through

Melt butter in a large saucepan, add onion and sauté until translucent, add rice and stir to coat with butter, add white wine and cook until evaporated, add broth and saffron, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the rice is cooked and creamy, stir in Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper

ingredients: 1/2 cup brewed espresso or strong coffee
cooking_method: Beat egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale, heat milk in a saucepan, add egg mixture and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thick and creamy, remove from heat and let cool, beat heavy cream and vanilla until soft peaks form, fold in mascarpone cheese and egg mixture, dip ladyfingers in espresso and rum mixture, arrange in a single layer in a dish, spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers, repeat layers, dust with cocoa powder

Preheat oven to 350°F, brush bread slices with olive oil, place on a baking sheet, bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until lightly toasted, mix tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl, spoon tomato mixture over toasted bread slices
